thread.section_title: HTDS Content Services is South Asia’s biggest syndication news agency with a vast collection of News, Images and Cartoons. Apart from Hindustan Times and Mint, HTDS Content Services disseminates a wide spectrum of licensed content from more than 200 publications. The content is packaged and syndicated to a broad range of global clients. HTDS Content Services also offers a rare collection of images and cartoons from Hindustan Times Archives
thread.title: MP: Cheetah Gamini and her 5 cubs enjoy monsoon showers at Kuno National Park
thread.title_full: MP: Cheetah Gamini and her 5 cubs enjoy monsoon showers at Kuno National Park

title: MP: Cheetah Gamini and her 5 cubs enjoy monsoon showers at Kuno National Park
text: New Delhi [India], July 5 (ANI): South African [Cheetah](/topic/cheetah) ' [Gamini](/topic/gamini)' with her five cubs on Friday morning, enjoyed the [rain](/topic/rain) at [Kuno National Park](/topic/kuno-national-park) in [Madhya Pradesh](/topic/madhya-pradesh) [Sheopur](/topic/sheopur). [Cheetah](/topic/cheetah) [Gamini](/topic/gamini) was seen playing with her cubs, who also engaged in playful antics with each other. Union Minister Bhupender Yadav shared the joyous moment in a post on X, stating, "Together, they weave a timeless tale of familial harmony amidst nature's seasonal embrace." Earlier on March 10, South African [Cheetah](/topic/cheetah) ' [Gamini](/topic/gamini)' gave birth to five cubs at [Kuno National Park](/topic/kuno-national-park). An announcement in this regard was made by Union Minister for Environment, Forest and Climate Change Bhupender Yadav on Sunday. The Union Minister said that the total number of Indian-born [Cheetah](/topic/cheetah) cubs has gone up to 13. "High Five, Kuno! Female cheetah [Gamini](/topic/gamini), age about 5 years, brought from Tswalu Kalahari Reserve, South Africa, has given birth to 5 cubs today. This takes the tally of the Indian-born cubs to 13. This is the fourth cheetah litter on Indian soil and the first litter of cheetahs brought from South Africa," Bhupender Yadav said in a post on X. He lauded the officers and staff at [Kuno National Park](/topic/kuno-national-park) for ensuring a 'stress-free environment' for the cheetahs. "Congratulations to all, especially the team of forest officers, vets, and field staff who have ensured a stress-free environment for cheetahs, which has led to successful mating and birth of the cubs. The total number of cheetahs, including cubs in [Kuno National Park](/topic/kuno-national-park), is 26. [Gamini](/topic/gamini)'s legacy leaps forward: Introducing her adorable cubs!" he said. Earlier in January this year, Namibian [Cheetah](/topic/cheetah) 'Jwala' gave birth to four cubs at [Kuno National Park](/topic/kuno-national-park). [Cheetah](/topic/cheetah)s were declared extinct in India in 1952, only to be reintroduced through the ambitious project in 2022. In 2022, eight [Cheetah](/topic/cheetah)s - brought from Namibia - were introduced in India under Project [Cheetah](/topic/cheetah). Subsequently, twelve cheetahs from South Africa were also translocated and released in [Kuno National Park](/topic/kuno-national-park) in February 2023. A cheetah translocated from Namibia, died at [Kuno National Park](/topic/kuno-national-park) in January this year. So far, seven adult cheetahs and three cubs born in India have died since March 2023. (ANI)
